reviewText:
Sure, many people will look at this game as a 'hurr boobs' or 'lol hentai 10/10 gotyay' but this review aims to look at the pros and cons of 'Sakura Clicker' and trying to analyse the subliminal messages of the game and what the developers and designers tried to get across to the audience.

Firstly, when you start the game, we are greeted with two half naked girls. My first impression was to be immidietely confused as to what was before me, as endless sands, as far as the eye can see, streched beyond in the background.
I soon found out that the girl on the right was in fact an image of the main protagonist of the game, whom is not named. This was probably done by the designers to further give the player a sense of confusion as the game started, but later grew aware of the situation before them.
After hours upon hours of trying to figure out what was going on in front of me, I noticed that I could, in fact, click on the screen to deal damage to a red bar that said 'Anubis'. From my understanding of Greek mythology, I had a grasp on what the God looked like, but he was no where around. Once again I felt confused, and I must give it to the designers for this amazing design choice. Bravo.
Never the less, I regained consciousness and continued to click as I observed the red bar slowly departing. As the red bar was vanquished, so was the girl on the left. I think this was done this way to symbolise that our time on earth is not unlimited and that when our red bars vaporise from existance, so do we, as human beings. With the sudden departure of the girl on the left, another took its place.
I was blown away by this design choice, as this was now a different girl called 'Boar'. This was clearly a design choice to show that even when the old die, the young take their place in society and shows that the way our society works nowadays is that we follow in each other's footsteps.
I do not think that I am a genius in any way, but I know I can't possibly fathom what the designers and developers were thinking, though I have a fair understanding of their clear and some what readable subliminal messaging. Just like Stanley Kubrick with his master piece 'Citizen Kane', there are multiple layers of meanings here that I have yet to even scratch the surface of.

Either way, I continued relentlessly and strived forward towards some visible goal. I have yet to find one. But I click never the less. For what purpose...

To conclude, this game is more than just 'ecchi boobs' and 'half naked females'. Mind you, it might look that way to the naked eye, but the masterful designers and developers of this marvelous project clearly left subliminal messages about the way the world is today and the society we live in. I share this message with you as I can clearly see between the lines and have educated myself on the importance of the message that 'Sakura Clicker' is trying to portray with its excellence.

I have to go now, my parents said I'm only allowed to use the computer for 2 hours a day because I watch too many Japanese cartoons. Thanks for reading my review, bye!

Have you ever had trouble sleeping, lying awake wondering what decisions you made in your past that led you to the present moment and why you're in your current life situation? Sakura Clicker is that in video game form. The idea is idiotically simple, click on sexy anime girls, who wince and cry out in pain while you do, until you kill them and earn gold. Repeat until the end of time. But this game, like other clicker games, is one giant skinner box technique but unlike Adventure Capitalist, I actually played it for longer than five minutes. My experience went into three stages.

Stage 1: Incredulity
As I began playing, it was almost too stupid to comprehend. You click on the girls until their numbers go down and they die, you scoop up the gold and it was hard to believe that more people were playing this than Lord of the Rings Online or Defiance, F2P titles with actual gameplay. Maybe it was the admittedly well-designed anime girls, but that's even worse because there are multiple hentai sites where people can see the whole thing instead of this ecchi skinner box. Stage one was probably the best time to write the game off, but I didn't.

Stage 2: Complacency
Around Zone 4, the game enters a bit of a lull. Your characters become powerful enough to where you don't have to do anything other than scoop up the gold. This is the part of the game that you could literally play one-handed. Eventually, you get into a routine where you sit around and collect the gold, only moving the mouse away from the play field to keep your characters up to speed. This is where the sexy nature begins to come in. The characters moan in a highly sexual fashion as you're clicking the ♥♥♥♥ out of them and the enemy character designs become quite appealing, minus the cancerous white spots on the top of the breasts. You enter a zen-like state where the only thing that matters is keeping your DPS up.

Stage 3: Chemical High
Around Zone 7, that power creep dimishes greatly and you as the player have to become more active. Eventually, the difficulty increases to the point where you're back to clicking as fast as you can because your other characters have lost their edge. Your senses begin to highten, going back and forth between the battlefield and your character sidebarn as you struggle to keep up with the difficulty spike. Especially once you get the gold rush move for your main character, filling the play field with gold like you just won the Megabucks jackpot in Vegas. By this time, the skinner box is in full effect. I ended up hurting my fingers with all the clicking, which is not the way I would have expected the average SC player to hurt their wrist. I gave myself temporary RSI over freaking anime boobs. Somehow I pulled myself away, probably to give my hand a break.

After taking a break to write this review, the idea of spending nearly an hour on this game is beginning to sink in. Imagine the things a person could do in an hour. One could watch a great TV show, read a chapter in a enlightening book, anything other than clicking on anime boobs. Yet, I'm probably not going to uninstall the game and the no vote is a very borderline one at that. I can see myself coming back to this with a beer in hand, just looking for very basic gameplay to give me a brief rush. But that begs the question, am I playing Sakura Clicker or is Sakura Clicker playing me? I spent a bunch of time writing a narrative review at one in the morning for a ♥♥♥♥ing clicker game so the latter might be true. In short, I have no idea why I played it but I did.

reviewText:
It's anime verging on hentai. Excessive display of skin, but no nudity.

It's free, and has steam cards. You should be ok with your friends laughing at you, and be ok with embarrassment too.

Graphics are ok, some backgrounds are really pretty too. The girls you fight have some variety in costumes, some of them aren't too bad. There are a few costumes that cover more of the body, but all of the girls have an unrealistic body shape, which is the main selling point. Clearly it's marketed towards lovers of a very specific bust size.

I enjoyed the voices the most. There are several voice actors - it depends if you bother with clicking or letting the computer auto-attack as to how often you'll hear the voices as they depend on critical hits and defeats. Gameplay resembles the Steam summer sale minigame from 2015, as the levels increase so too does your damage and enemy health, exponentially rising into the thousands, millions, billions, trillions, then something called 'aa' which is possibly a Scrooge McDuck money bin the size of a planet.

Additional skills and party members can be purchased to keep your damage comparable to the enemies' health.

Get it if you want to check out the art, or want the cards - but I don't recommend playing it for extended periods, it gets repetitive too quick. Possibly ok with your morning cuppa for 5 minutes, but that's all. 6/10 for something to do between other somethings.

Final note: Always remember there are female gamers on Steam. Don't disrespect them, realise that the girls depicted here are ridiculous, smile then move on.

If there's one thing done right there, beside the many things, is that it feels honest to you: you never feel cheated on because everything's mathematically correct.

Sakura Clicker feels like a rushed game because of many reasons but the progress is certainly one of the worst. You feel like the developers just tried something to see how it goes, without putting much thinking into it.
Most of the game is a copy/paste of Clicker Heroes (ascensions included) but with all of the functional changes done wrong.
This ends up in upgrade cost being too high for the damage dealt, so the only good thing to do is to upgrade each ally 3 to 5 times then wait to buy the next one, and that wait means close the game and come back later. I know that happens to Clicker Heroes too, but here I mean literally play 2 minutes then idle for 5 hours or more. All the time.

Since the aug 3rd update this situation got better, because the devs raised the damage a great lot, but that also proves the fact that this whole thing was just badly planned at the beginning, and it still doesn't feel right.

This game suffer from many problems, and even though the devs seem to listen to the players and actually implement stuff that most people are asking, that could have be done before releasing it, and anyway we're far from something working right.

It all feels like a cardboard game, with little to no animations (the only one being the enemies closing their eyes when beaten), just a few 8-bit like sound effects, and a short looping music that will get annoying very soon. The character design is nice but  it is just an excuse to attract people, because that's really the only good thing of this game.
That said, those girls are just random, and there doesn't seem to be any pattern in their dressing. Bosses are just the same girls, but stronger.
Your character is shown on the playfield, and you can change its appearance in a specific tab of the game. Most stuff has to be purchased with real-world money before being able to wear it (like the most sexy dresses), and that's the only thing you can purchase. The problem is that it just stand there doing nothing, so it doesn't really make sense to even be there.

This game really feels like a quick cash-grab as there's nothing interesting to do while it runs beside purchasing upgrades, which, as I said, isn't really anything strategical since you just purchase the best ally and forget about the rest, so for most of the time you'll just have the game closed collecting money for you.

The progress is non-existant as you can't really see any beside the small number indicating the level, because the game is always the same: random girls with a new random background every 10 levels.

The worst thing about this game, though, is that you don't know where you are going.
On Clicker Heroes you always have a clear objective, which isn't only to get further than your last ascension but it also gives you some clear short/mid/long range objectives to achieve and a little bonus if you manage to complete them, which are the in-game achievements. You have a reason to go further and a clear objective, and you also see an ending point to reach.

In this game you don't have any. You just beat these always-the-same enemies for no reason at all, forever.
Reaching further bosses has no meaning either, as they are simply another randomly-dressed girl which gives you nothing more than some coin, as all the other enemies.

I see it as if this game tried to be another clicker with its own identity, but this new identity failed to be attractive and don't even work right.

TL:DR The new update annihilated the game, don't waste your time until the positive reviews start coming back.

The long version is that the game had some minor balancing issues, it played less like a clicker game and more like a macro game until you got to higher zones, when finally your clicks mattered to how much damage you'd do. Additionally, Attack Speed was a little broken since (as far as I know from how far I got into the game, about zone 40-45) you could only get attack speed with Spirits, so you'd spend your spirits on Attack Speed and get Damage and Gold Gain from leveling your girls to level 200, 400 or 600.

Taking this minor balancing issue into consideration, the devs decided to murk the entire game and put it into an unplayable state, your clicks matter more and you're able to use an ability to essencially get 100% crit chance (crits now do x10 damage instead of x2, HOWEVER the ability takes 30 minutes to refresh) but now leveling the girls gives barely any damage, and your click damage in the mid to late game is dependant on the damage of your girls (You gain a % of their damage towards your clicks). It now takes hours to defeat some of the earlier bosses that you'd previously be able to beat your first or second try after collecting a small amount of gold.

The only positive thing I can say is that it's nice that the damage your girls deal to the enemy isn't 'chunky' anymore, and now the enemy health bar slides down. Legitimately the only positive thing I can say.

reviewText: Many people will ridicule this game for being what it is, but I truly believe that this game is an amazing experience and everyone should play it. One of the parts of this game I really enjoyed was the story. There was no clear story ever presented in game, but because of this I was able to use my imagination to create the explanation of why I was fighting a seemingly endless horde of monsters in the middle of the desert. Another thing I really liked about this game was the character customization. While I couldn't figure out how to change my gender, I was greeted with plenty of other customization options such as changing my outfit, hair style, hair color, and even my face. The graphics seemed to be very simple at first, but as I played the game I understood the deeper meaning as to why the enemies looked like what they did. Although there was no tutorial, the controls were very easy to learn and master. The sounds in this game were definitely very pleasing to listen to. The DLC in this game is an amazing addition to the quality of this masterpiece. The developers of this game are true geniuses for making this beautiful work of art. The only thing that could make this game better is online multiplayer, which I'm absolutely sure many people would enjoy. Although I might consider this a revolutionary free to play game, the highest i can give it is 7.8/10 because it has too much water.
